section.title: Using the edit parameters dialog to add, edit and delete references
section.para:
You can use the edit parameters dialog to add, edit and delete parameters for a Test Case or a central test data set. This section is concerned with using the dialog for editing parameters in a Test Case. For editing parameters for a central test data set, see the section later ().
Also there is the possibility to restrict the values which could be used in the data .
To edit the parameters for a Test Case:

listitem.para: Open the edit parameters dialog by right-clicking on the root node in the Test Case Editor and selecting Edit parameters from the context-sensitive menu.
In the dialog, you can see any parameters you have referenced for this Test Case, and what type of parameters they are.
From the dialog, you can add new parameters to the Test Case, edit existing parameters, and delete parameters. You can also change the order the parameters appear in.
Use the lock option to lock the parameters for this Test Case. This means that you cannot delete them, rename them or remove them in this Test Case.
In the Properties View, you can only add references for parameters. To edit or delete references, you must use this dialog.

section.title: Add and edit ValueSets for Parameters
section.para: After Selecting a Parameter in the Edit Parameters Dialog, you can edit the allowed values for this parameter. Therefore the Edit Value Set Dialog will be opened. You can add and remove values in the allowed Values Table and select a default value in the combobox.
